contextId.information: The terms "grace" and "peace" are metonyms for the person who acts toward people in a kindly and peaceful manner. AT: "May God be kind to you and give you peace" (UDB). (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: May grace and peace be to you

contextId.information: The Thessalonians are the reason for his joy. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "crown" refers to a laurel wreath awarded to victorious athletes. The expression "crown of pride" means a reward for victory, or having done well. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

"those who are not believers in Christ." Paul speaks of "the faith" as if it were a place. Here "the faith" refers to those who trust in Christ. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: those who are outside the faith
